meanings.definition: To expel a person from a country
meanings.sent1: The government decided to deport the illegal immigrant.
meanings.sent2: The authorities had to deport the criminal back to his home country.
meanings.sent3: The country had to deport the troublemaker to maintain peace.
meanings.sent4: The decision to deport the spy was made swiftly and quietly.
meanings.sent5: The act of deporting someone is a serious matter with legal implications.

meanings.definition: To behave in a particular manner
meanings.sent1: He tends to deport himself with great confidence.
meanings.sent2: She will deport herself professionally during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to deport himself seriously, but it was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the actor will deport himself as a king.
meanings.sent5: It is important to deport yourself appropriately in formal settings.

meanings.sent1: The truck will deport the goods to the warehouse.
meanings.sent2: The ship will deport the passengers to the island.
meanings.sent3: The magic carpet will deport you to a land of wonders.
meanings.sent4: The wind will deport the fallen leaves across the field.
meanings.sent5: The mission is to deport the supplies safely to the base.
